questions.question_text:
An application runs on multiple Amazon EC2 instances that access a shared file system simultaneously.

Which AWS storage service should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
EBS: Attaches only to 1 instance at a time.
EFS: Network File System, you can attach to multiple instances at a time.

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon EFS

Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) is a shared file storage service for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances. It allows multiple EC2 instances to access a shared file system simultaneously. EFS is designed to be highly available and durable, and automatically scales to the amount of data stored on it. EFS is a perfect fit for applications that require shared access to files, such as big data, analytics, and content management.

Which AWS service or feature meets these requirements?

This allows for centralized management and control of network traffic between VPCs, simplifying network architecture and reducing administrative overhead.

B. AWS Direct Connect

AWS Direct Connect is a service that allows users to establish a dedicated and private network connection from their internal network to the AWS Cloud. Direct Connect provides a more reliable and lower-latency connection between on-premises data centers and AWS by bypassing the public Internet. This allows users to seamlessly transfer large amounts of data, such as backups, into the cloud or between different AWS regions.

AWS CloudHSM is a service that provides hardware-based key storage for cryptographic operations.

Amazon Connect is a cloud-based contact center service.

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Direct Connect

"AWS Direct Connect is a networking service that provides an alternative to using the internet to connect to AWS. Using AWS Direct Connect, data that would have previously been transported over the internet is delivered through a private network connection between your facilities and AWS. In many circumstances, private network connections can reduce costs, increase bandwidth, and provide a more consistent network experience than internet-based connections. All AWS services, including Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), and Amazon DynamoDB can be used with AWS Direct Connect."

AWS Direct Connect is a high-speed, low-latency connection that allows you to access public and private AWS Cloud services from your local (on-premises) infrastructure. The connection is enabled via dedicated lines and bypasses the public Internet to help reduce network unpredictability and congestion.

AWS Site-to-Site VPN
Sometimes called AWS-managed VPN, AWS Site-to-Site VPN is a hardware IPsec VPN that enables you to create an encrypted connection between Amazon VPC and your private IT infrastructure over the public Internet. VPN connections allow you to extend existing on-premises networks to your VPC as if they were running in your infrastructure.

B. Amazon ElastiCache

Amazon ElastiCache is a web service that makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale an in-memory data store or cache in the cloud. ElastiCache supports two open-source in-memory caching engines: Memcached and Redis. ElastiCache is fully managed and can be easily integrated with other AWS services, such as Amazon RDS, DynamoDB, and Redshift. It provides a cost-effective, high-performance, and fully managed solution that allows customers to quickly and easily add caching to their applications, improving their performance and responsiveness.

Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that supports document and key-value data structures.

Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) is a block storage service for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances.

Amazon Redshift is a fully managed data warehouse service that enables customers to analyze large amounts of data using SQL and BI tools.
